name: Okta Customizations
title: Okta Customizations
body:
Overview

Customization will only take place on Okta side. There won’t be any customization that are tenant specific.

For tracking changes to the current customization solution see the following repository:

https://bitbucket.org/qbengineering/okta_resource_login_customization/src/master/

The following link might be helpful to understand how the Okta Sign-In works - it gives a rough overview of the states of a login:

https://github.com/okta/okta-auth-js#transactionstatus

This article is for documentation purposes only, since customizations are outside of support scope.

The login page HTML is hosted in Okta. Is has to be manually uploaded after building from the login repository.

The assets (like CSS, JS, images) loaded by the login page are delivered by an nginx container running in our cluster. This is created via pipeline from the login and email repositories. Versions of the image have to be updated manually. 

The logo shown in the emails is also delivered by the same nginx container.

The repositories for email and login are merged in the pipeline. This is a custom pipeline.

 

Table of Contents

  • Okta Login Customization

Okta Login Customization

Brands - Content Security Policy

Configure the Default CSP

  1. In the Admin Console, go to Customizations > Brands.

  2. In the Pages panel under Sign-in Page and Error Page, click Configure.

  1. Click Settings.

  2. In the Content Security Policy panel, click Edit and set the following:

  • Trusted external resources: https://production.static-okta-assets.customervoice360.com/

  • Report URI: optional - Enter the URI for violation reports.

  • Enforcement: Not enforced (Report-only mode)

  1. Click Save to draft.

If you'd like to see the previous solution (discontinued), you can consult Confluence: Login Customization - Tivian Access - Confluence

Okta Error Customization

See Okta errors to get more information about the type of Okta errors that can be encountered.

Error page customization especially takes place in case of errors that occur on Okta side that will not redirect back to the respective installation. 

The error customization takes place in a Bitbucket repository:

https://bitbucket.org/qbengineering/okta_resource_login_customization/src/master/

Also see:

https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/custom-error-pages/overview/

Okta E-mail Customization

Okta offers e-mail templating for different e-mail types. Okta will send e-mails directly to a user in all cases that are related to identity management. Currently e-mail notifications cannot be switched off.

Cases for Okta E-Mails:

Flow

User Action

Explanation

User Activation

User gets an activation link to set a password.

An Okta managed user should activate their account. This can happend when a user is create or activated.

Forgot Password Denied

No Action

A user tried to change their password but is not allowed to do that. This can happen in case a user tries to follow the forgot password flow without ever being logged in.

Password Reset by Admin

User gets an activation link to set a new password

Admin triggered resetting a password.

Forgot Password

User gets an forgot password link to set a new password.

A user fogort a password and triggers the forgot password flow. The user has to be allowed to do that - at least logged in onces

MFA Factor Enrollment

No action

A user gets informed that another factor has be configured for their account. This occurs for example if a user adds Google Authenticator as second factor.

This e-mail could be disabled

MFA Factor Reset

No action

A user gets informed that the multi factor configuration was removed. The user has to provide MFA enrollment again.

This e-mail could be disabled

New Device Notification

New Sign-On Notification

No action

It seems this e-mail is related to a new device that performs a login.

This e-mail could be disabled

Change Email Notification

???

This might occur if an admin changes an e-mail address. This should be an extremly rare case.

It might also happen in case e-mails are changed from lower-case to uper-case or the like.

E-Mail Verification

X

Occurs during MFA via e-mail.

E-mail MFA is an early access features and not part of our configuration.

E-Mail Challenge

X

Occurs during MFA via e-mail.

E-mail MFA is an early access features and not part of our configuration.

 

Redirecting after e-mail action:

Some e-mails lead to an action a user has to fulfill on Okta side (activation, reset password). In that cases Okta does not know the context - especially the app - in which the user action happens. Therefore the redirect after the action will lead to a default page.

This can be changed using a “fromURI” field for the respective link in the e-mail as query parameter. It will have the value of the URL to the page that the user should be redirected after the action is done.

Example:

<a href="{activationLink}?fromURI=http://google.com">Activate your account</a>

 

Okta Multilanguage Support

We are currently not storing the user’s language in Okta. Thus providing different language for the emails might be useless.

Enabling and disabling languages:

Where

enable

disable

login success screen

currently EFS multi-language capabilities could be used

currently EFS multi-language capabilities could be used

error-screen

currently no multi-language capabilities

currently no multi-language capabilities

login-screen

manipulate the user language settings in the sign-in-widget

manipulate custom language files or loading path (not recommended)

manipulate the user langugage settings in the sign-in-widget

manipulate custom language files or loading path (not recommended)

e-mails (assumption: emails are customized)

add a new email template for the respective language

remove the email template for the respective language

 

Customize translations

Where

customization options

login success screen

current EFS multi-language capabilities could be used

error-screen

currently no multi-language capabilities

login-screen

  1. manipulate the langugage directly when setting up the widget (not recommended)

  2. provide own language files for the widget for all supported languages and manipualte the language loading (recommended)

  3. rewrite the sign-in widget (not recommended)

e-mails (assumption: emails are customized)

create the email version for a specific language upfront and upload it to the email customizations
